qas.question: Was Burma effected by the world wars?

answers.text: Burma was devastated during World War II

qas.question: Did the British protect Burma as its colony during WWII?
Where groups from Burma an advantage to the Allies during WWII?

answers.text: British Chindits were formed into long-range penetration groups trained to operate deep behind Japanese lines. A similar American unit, Merrill's Marauders

qas.question: How many soldiers were lost by the Japanese in Burma during WWII ?

answers.text: the Japanese lost some 150,000 men in Burma

qas.question: When did the temporary Japanese rule end in Burma?

answers.text: the end of Japanese rule in July 1945

context: A major battleground, <a0_0>Burma was devastated during World War II<a0_0/>. By March 1942, within months after they entered the war, Japanese troops had advanced on Rangoon and <a1_0>the British administration had collapsed<a1_0/>. A Burmese Executive Administration headed by Ba Maw was established by the Japanese in August 1942. Wingate's <a2_0>British Chindits were formed into long-range penetration groups trained to operate deep behind Japanese lines. A similar American unit, Merrill's Marauders<a2_0/>, followed the Chindits into the Burmese jungle in 1943. Beginning in late 1944, allied troops launched a series of offensives that led to <a4_0>the end of Japanese rule in July 1945<a4_0/>. The battles were intense with much of Burma laid waste by the fighting. Overall, <a3_0>the Japanese lost some 150,000 men in Burma<a3_0/>. Only 1,700 prisoners were taken.
